cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west across the Florida Straits tonight, turning WNW Monday, then NW Tuesday, and forecast to arc NE toward Florida’s Big Bend and cross northern Florida into the Atlantic late Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys, southeast Gulf of Mexico, and Florida Gulf coast from the Keys north-eastward through the Big Bend; later Georgia–Carolinas coast
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤7%) of sustained 34-kt winds; breezy conditions possible mid-week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Pascagoula given storm track well east
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands possible late Wednesday–Thursday; totals generally <2 inches
